description: My friends and I had late lunch at this restaurant around 4:30pm on 11/01/16.My friend ordered my a bowl of northern style beef noodle soup before I got there,so when I get there I didn't like the taste and style of it so I was talking to my friend about it in Vietnamese then a restaurant busboy came over and said "You'll love it and get hook on it" then a waitress came and told me "if I don't like it,don't come back here."After she left my friend said that was the owner daughter so I told my friend I don't care,I have a right to say I don't like the food..but I didn't say anything to them at all...So when my friend asked for the bill and paid it,but the waitress took the bill and money to the counter and yelling out to my friend if she needs some change back then my friend asked me"Should I leave tips?" I told my friend"no,this restaurant is very unprofessional and I know the owner takes all the tips,it doesn't go to workers" so the waitress came over again and told me"I'm a bad person and I'm controlling my friend money".I've been to this restaurant before a long time ago and I didn't like their style of cooking plus bad services and too much MSG.I've come again this time to please my friend.I don't even come if it is free,just put it that way.
author: leona t.

description: Their Chicken Pho is different from what I'm use to. No bean sprouts, basil, limes and hoisin sauce. (So don't wait thinking someone will rush out with a plate filled with these items.) It's the Northern style pho. Overall, the broth was pretty good with the additions of the lemon and jalapeños provided. It's Cash only here.
author: Chi C.

description: best chicken Pho ever !!!! It feels like home !!!
author: Trang N.

description:
The service here is very quick.

I've been here on two occasions. First occasion I had 
Ph Bò Ðc Bit
Combination of Rare Beef, Tripe, Well-done Beef Noodle Soup

It was decent.

Second occasion I had
Ph Gà
Chicken Noodle Soup

Which I've been told is their specialty. It's tasty and it seems healthy.

Their Vietnamese coffee is good too, although its expensive ($3) for the amount they give you.
author: Eric S.

description: Fantastic soy drink,and everything's so nice like everyone else say. server is so sweet, you defiantly will like it!!
author: Yue F.

description:
Not quite as good as before(chicken pho).
As other people have pointed out, mainly the chicken soup base is not as good. But still one of the best in the city. 
Also, I wish they give a little bit more noodle.
author: Dragon F.

description:
First time at the new location and was not disappointed at all.

Ordered two bowls of the chicken pho, one small and one large, with 2 side orders of imperial rolls ($2.25 each), but probably could've skipped on those.

I'm not sure if it was just a little busy, but food took a lot longer to come out than it usually does at the other locations.  We waited for a good 15-20 minutes after ordering.

Bowls came out hot, and I was excited to eat mine!  I was surprised of how much noodles were in my bowl.  I didn't remember it being so much, but hey, more for the money!

We will be back soon!
author: Nancy S.

description: TT has always been great but today, I decided to go to their Larkin branch.  The #1 was saltier and had less meat.  They used the cheap kind of beef brisket.  The reason i go to TT is because of their better cuts of meat in the Pho vs the typical Pho restaurants. Was truly disappointed. Go to the TT Geary branch instead*
author: Kitty C.

description: The #4 is the best. The meat is extremely tender and they give you a lot. The meat is thick and succulent.
author: Ezekiel Y.

description:
Came here around 12:30 on a Friday and had to wait about 20 minutes. Not bad, especially if you didn't know it was CASH ONLY and use the time wisely to find an ATM.

Special aspect of Turtle Tower: Northern Viet style pho with chicken broth, slab of smashed beef over it, plus some tripe and green onions. Phenomenally simple and tasty. 

Wanted the Cha Muc (Deep Fried Cuttle Fish Patty) but apparently they don't serve it anymore.
author: Joanna H.

description:
IF you come to this place expecting to be treated as a king, you are in the wrong planet!!!!!! They do have decent service and considering the price they offer, I would say it is more than enough! 

If you seek for the best Pho-Ga ( Chicken Pho)  in San Francisco Bay Area, you will not be disappointed. I really recommend #8 (Pho-Ga)or #9 (Pho-Ga w/Giblets) for first timer. #6 and #7 is also my favorite.
author: Dan A.

description: Pho tastes like water and they wouldn't let me swap out my meal for something else... One star for horrible pho and customer service
author: Jasmine P.

description:
I haven't been to Turtle Tower for a long time, but when I came back they moved. The new location is 2 houses to the right from the old location. The new place has two floors but I'm not sure why they're not using the second floor because it gets very crowded in the afternoon. When I got there it was around 12:35 pm, the line went outside the building but that's because they don't have that much space inside for people to wait. The wait time was approximately 15 minutes for a table of two on a saturday. I eat pho around the whole city and I still think the chicken noodle soup is the best.

Turtle Tower is Hanoi northern style, meaning you won't get any side garnishes or bean sprouts because they don't serve those in the northern vietnamese style. Personally going to Turtle Tower a lot of times in my life when I was smaller, I think the best item they have on the menu would be the chicken noodle soup. Now at the new location the 2nd best item in my opinion would be #2, the rare beef noodle soup. The broth is the main key for this restaurant, it has very good tasting soup and noodles. When I asked for white meat, I got white meat, and believe me, every single chicken was white. The price for two was around $18, so yes it's a bit pricey for a bowl of noodles but you get what you pay for. If you are still not full after a bowl of pho, you can always order the imperial rolls with vermicelli, you will most definitely be full because I ordered the imperial rolls to go and it was delicious when I ate it at home. 

 
The restaurant environment is very calm. My thoughts when I walked in the new location was that it has a good setup, nice counter and a big kitchen for the workers, most importantly it has over 20 seats. So yes, the line does go fast even when it all the way outside. Do you know how I know there's a big kitchen? There's a servery window, so you can see the whole kitchen and how they prepare their food through that servery window. The building has a big glass window outside, so anyone can look inside and see you eating. But on the bright side you can watch over your car or what's happening outside. If you're a sports fan, this is the right place for you. They have 2 big TV inside the dining hall that's always broadcasting sports. They also have decorations around the whole building. If you look around there's frames with black and white photos inside them. It shows the pictures of Hanoi in the old time. 

The staff there was very kind, they told us the approximate wait time when you go inside to sign up for the wait list. And no, it's not those kind of servers who tells you a wait time that's completely inaccurate. When we were called in, it was like a typical restaurant. Get your name called, seated and order. I ordered the most famous item on their menu, the Chicken noodle soup. I looked around after ordering, most of the people there ordered chicken noodle soup so that's probably the best dish they have. I was surprised when the food came in 3 minutes even when they were on busy hours.The servers there are very fluent in their languages, most of them speak three languages, english, chinese and vietnamese. The servers are usually around you, so it's not hard to call them over if you want to order something. 

I would most definately come back to turtle tower when I have a chance, they had great customer service, good environment. last not least best pho in the city in my opinion! I eat pho every weekend so I have very high expectations when I'm eating pho since I come from a Vietnamese family. My family can make the same food as most restaurants but Turtle Tower has the broth that my family does not know how to make. Therefore it's one of the best pho places in the city. Just remember that turtle tower only accepts cash, don't bring a credit card because they will just tell you leave something expensive at the restaurant and get money from the bank. If I were to give a advice to this restaurant, I would suggest opening up the upstairs too so the line won't be that long. If you don't want to wait that long, I suggest you to go to their other two locations. There's one at Outer Richmond at Geary and there's another at SoMa at 6th street.
author: Wilson L.

description:
Decent portions of Pho, but the chicken pho had the best soup!
Be prepared for a wait as this is a popular location.
author: William L.

description:
The new place they moved into seems so much cleaner so kudos for them because the old location was just too sticky and disjointed for me. Location apparently makes a big difference in  influencing my taste buds because we ordered a Large Pho to go and it was enough for both of us to get full off of. 
I've tried their Pho Ga at the old location before and it was only okay. I'm willing to try again. Maybe it was just a bad batch. Since its so close to my bf's place, I'm sure I'll be back again.
author: Elaine L.

description: Turtle tower or torture tower?! Wish I could rate 0 star...  My stomach felt funny after having pho#4 (mediocre beef/tripe and soup a bit salty), spring roll (bland and I highly suspect the quality of the shrimp), grilled pork( the only okay item ), and Vietnamese coffee. And finally threw up after 10hrs torture of my stomach! Won't go back again...
author: Jennifer S.

description: 5 stars is just for the imperial rolls. Rice paper thin skin stuffed with finely diced vegetable meat filling. None greasy and totally delicious!! Whenever I am in this neighborhood I make a special trek to this place just for the imperial rolls. Best of the best in this City. No other place have I found skin so thin with just the right degree of crisp.
author: Giovani T.

description: Best Pho ever!!! Co worker brought me back a #5 with chicken and I am in love!  I want to go back again again!!
author: stephany m.

description:
Having just returned from Vietnam and being seduced by Pho in its birth place, Hanoi, I went looking for this elusive, simpler style of Pho in my home town.

I tried the simple Pho with well done and rare beef.

Noodles - good. Slightly over cooked but at least the correct wide variety.

Meat - good. 

Broth - not as hot as it should be and lacking that Hanoi taste. I think they use star anise.

Herbs and condiments - here's my biggest gripe. The herbs were not right and neither was the fresh chili on the side.
All over Vietnam you get thinly sliced red chilies that are like their Thai cousins.
They are fiery as he'll and add a great flavor to the broth.
Sadly these seemed to use the sliced green ones that every other restaurant does.

So, I'll give it 4 out of 5 because it is close to the real thing.
I guess the analogy is Ramen which is always way better in Japan.
author: Colin J.

description: honestly don't know why people like this place so much. There really is NOTHING like-able about it. The portions are small, the food is bland, and the ambience is pretty much what you would expect at any local Vietnamese restaurant. Their famous chicken pho just tastes like home-made Chinese chicken soup with some rice noodles in it. Most people I know love this place though, so maybe it's just me! But I've tried it several times and still haven't liked it more!
author: Catherine C.

description: I LOVE PHO GA!!!!!!! Wish they have another branch at bay area!!! Tried many pho places, but nothing can beat their pho ga (so far) haha. Tried some appetizer too, and its also soo good.... Nuff said!!
author: Wei Y.

description: Chicken Pho: overrated and tasteless. (Rating: 2.5/5)
author: Jenny W.

description: best chicken pho in the city - I go to this place every time im home no matter what
author: Jon O.

description:
Oh no! What is happening now? I cant believe after moving to a new place, my the one and only bun cha hanoi restaurant turned to be like this! First of all, they do get improvements on the new location, which is cleaner, bigger, and fancier. However, the meat in bun cha hanoi seems to be drier, and thinner. Also, the fishsauce of the bun cha dish is so extremely salty that after the first couple bites my mouth shrank and my tongue stiffed. What is going on here? 

I also ordered an chicken pho with livers, kidneys, etc.. Guess what! The pho had no flavors and the meats were super soft. It looked like they "steamed" it for so long. The pho bowl looked big but to be honest, this is the "cheap a**" pho ever because they served you ridiculously less meats. The baby chicken egg also was cut into pieces. This is america, not in vietnam anymore. We eat meats more than noodles. Im short, this experience totally ruined my day. Everything about this restaurant I admired, loved, respected and enjoyed was completely destroyed.
author: Nate N.

description: I like their chicken pho!! Flavorful and a good proportion of noodles to meat. Some say that the soup can be salty, but when I tried it, it wasn't bad at all! Gonna come back again!
author: Hey Y.

description: The best pho in the state of California.  The noodles are so fresh and smooth, and the soup is incredible.  Drinking the soup makes you forget all your problems, it's that good (pho soup for the soul?) My favorite is the Pho Tai with rare beef but you can't go wrong with any pho here.  I also like the fresh spring rolls with shrimp.  Major cravings, especially on cold days.  Their old location was kinda dingy and would have warranted only 3.5-4 stars due to the lack of decor, but, the new location is much nicer with hardwood floors and is better appointed overall.
author: Natassia K.

description:
This place has some seriously bad dark JuJu energy!
The bald man, sits at the front, everyone refers to as the owner. Goes from maniacal grinning to seriously pissed off. 
It's so creepy, anyone else notice?
 Anyone had a meal where he didn't interfere and lay the law down on you?!
Also anyone else notice how he mistreats his employees, likes he owns them. They're busy, so I guess that equates to success?
Yet  there's half eaten bowls of noodles left behind at most tables?
Salty water, is how I would describe my broth water today.
First and last time.  Yucky monkey business going on here!!
author: Ame W.

description: Pretty much the same as before with a nicer restaurant.  I always get the Pho Ga with innards (dark meat only).
author: Patrick C.

description: Fast and attentive service. But for some reason the noodle is a little less delish than I had before
author: Prinya W.

description: Did not like their vermicelli dish,rather go to Kim son on balboa and 37th better food.
author: Cynthia B.

description: Yum - authentic Vietnamese style and taste. Soft home made noodles. Sausage patties are fresh off the grill taste. All good. I keep making the trip from across the bay 'cus it's worth the trip. then hop over to Lee's for their desserts. Complete Vietnamese experience!
author: Nancy T.

description: clean pho ga broth for a nice cold morning.  but chicken not quite as flavorful.  soft slippery wide noodle with lots of onion and parsley.  not as good as some oakland and sjc spots.  nicer decor inside not fitting of larkin
author: Rob C.

description: Just as good as any other turtle tower. You will notice that this place is packed with non Asian people and that your order is being taken by some non Asian dude. Don't let that fool you. Just order pho ga and trot on your happy way, little piggy.
author: Margaret S.

description: Read highly rated reviews throughout yelp so we decided to stop here while visiting sf....we ordered pho tai and pho ga.  The broth taste ok but the noodles are large rice version not the thin one.   Services were good but nothing to rave about.  Kinda disappointing.
author: LT T.

description: Service is good. The place was packed with Asians which was was a good sign. The chicken Pho was phenomenal. And the banhmi sandwiches are flavorful and a bargain.
author: Joni M.

description: Turtle Tower is one or my favorite places for pho ga(chicken noodle soup), as their Northern style pho is simple and tastes great.  The new location is only two stores down from their original location and more modern.
author: James Y.

description: Love the chicken pho here! The service is good and fast. I am taking one star out because of cash only policy and also because the soup flavor is not consistent- sometimes it tastes pretty bland, and other times it's great.
author: Aya J.

description: I love this place, I could literally eat here everyday. The chicken pho with the giblets is on point and the best. The service is great and consistent; everyone that works here is very nice and friendly. This place never disappoints.
author: Samantha Y.

description: Much-improved decor at the new site with a new upstairs, so double your pho pleasure. The Pho Ga is still one of the best bowls in SF. I think the lines are longer. I think you'll like this new & improved TT.
author: Derek N.

description:
Alright so it's my first trip to San Francisco and I am trying to experience all I can about this wonderful little city. I really wanted to indulge in the unique food culture here and not just the touristy spots. Anyway, I wanted pho and I mean good pho so I did a little research (thanks Yelp) and every time, this place came up as number 1. I walked the 25 minutes Google maps said it would take to get there from my hotel and like Moses parting the Red Sea, there it was: Turtle Tower. I was excited and ready for that big bowl of piping hot soup and then it happened.....I walked in the door and was standing there for about 2 mins and no one said a word to me. Then when I was finally greeted by a sweet older woman and seated, I thought it would get better. It did for the length of time it took for her to take my order and for my food to arrive. 

I ate my pho tai in silence (I was alone after all) and I must say it was delicious. I also ordered the yummy spring rolls. The pho was the best I've ever had. I couldn't stop eating it. Now I know you're asking yourself: If it was so good, why only 2 stars? Let me explain. Having worked in the retail industry (food service/retail all the same to me) for many years, I know what is expected of me to provide optimal customer service. I did not have the same experience at Turtle Tower. No one ever came back to my table to ask me how my meal was or if I needed anything else. Everyone around me was asked and anyone who walked in the door was greeted right away. It wasn't until I had to ask for more water (instead of someone noticing my glass was empty) did someone finally ask me about my meal. I told them the pho was delicious and the best I've ever had (which is true) and I smiled politely. I waited another 5 minutes for my check, paid, tipped and left. I was given a polite but emotionless thank you as walked out the door. 

Would I recommend this place for the pho, sure. Would I go again alone, probably not.

***Edit to this review***10/9/13

After talking with a friend of mine, he mentioned that I should make a little addition to this review which might also account for why I did not receive the same service as the other patrons in the establishment. I should point out that I was the only black woman in the restaurant. I didn't want to go there with the race card BUT it makes sense and the thought did cross my mind.
author: Robin F.

description:
Had been good before.  Wanted to have a delicious lunch.  Went today at 130.   Got seated right away.  Ordered pho #1.  Big big mistake.  When it came out, tasted the broth.  Was one of the saltiest broths.  Could not take it. Brought this to the attention of the waiter.  Got NO support.  Never offered a replacement.  In frustration asked for another empty bowl.  Ate the noodles separately without the salty broth.


Will be looking for a new northern vietnamese restaurant.
author: Bill L.

description: I was craving pho. I noticed they didn't have oyster sauce which made me sad. I saw they used different noodles which scared me. Once I got my pho and had a taste it was delicious. It tastes homemade. Clean and flavorful. I ordered the small and I am stuffed. They give you a lot more noodles than other places. Will be coming back.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Oh turtle tower, how I love thee.   I would eat the chicken pho in a hole in the wall, but it does taste a little more delicious in this nice new space.  Now serving Vietnamese fried chicken.
author: Wakako U.

description: I gave into the hype and tried it out. "Turt tow" as my friends and I like to refer to it, did not live up to its hype. What's good about it is that the pho is that its clean and flavorful. However, no sriracha, no variety of noodle soups (Bun Bo Hue) and no bean sprouts? That's just a pho-tastrophe. I guess I like my pho dirty...with extra additives. This place still helps the hangovers though...at 7 am.
author: Cassie C.

description: My impression of Northern Vietnamese cuisine was that it is generally pretty bland, and that's what I thought about the pho at Turtle Tower when I first tried it about 5 or so years ago.  However, during my most recent visit to the new location in the Tenderloin, I was blown away.  I ordered the pho tai chin; the broth was flavorful and fragrant and the noodles tasted fresh.  I look forward to my  next visit.
author: Thi D.

description: I honestly don't think the pho here is that great. the broth is salty, it taste like some broth drench with salt. the staff were nice, and the wait wasn't too bad. i really don't get the hype of this place. also had the imperial roll, it tasted like frozen rolls. maybe it wasn't my day, not sure but i'm definitely not coming back, it was just bad.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: Avoid this chain if you like authentic pho. They cut corners like not serving you basil and bean sprouts. They use lemon instead of lime. The food is OK but in little Saigon, there are many many better options. I recommend you to skip Turtle Tower.
author: Alfred L.

description: Came all the way from Tracy to eat here in Little Saigon.  Heard good things. Had the number 9 and the 12 for my wife.  Both of us had the same conclusion. Wasted trip better food in our area. Enough said.
author: Jose Z.

description:
This place is over-rated.  The soup is very weak, almost flavorless.  

I ate here three times, twice at the old address.  Every time, my opinion was still the same.  I often wondered why so many people line up here and so consistently rated it so well.  I preferred Pho 2000 and the Golden Lotus which took the previous Turtle Tower location.
author: Jay Z.

description: First of all, service is horrible. Servers yell at customers. Food is fully loaded with MSG. I felt thirsty all afternoon. I don't understand why they got so many good reviews. There are so many places that can make better pho than Torture Tower. Remember Turtle Tower is serving Northern Vietnamese cuisine. Their noodles don't come with bean sprouts, basil and cilantro.
author: J L.

description: Eddy N. is not used to sharing a table and found it to be a horrifying experience.  I get it Eddie-you're there to eat with someone you know. FYI, I've met several friends from sharing tables at TT.  It has always been common practice and is really no big deal. Everyone gets to eat their favorite pho ga sooner.
author: Lizzie D.

description: Best pho broth in the city... Lighter than most, tastes homemade. The crab imperial rolls are a most. Enjoy my sf natives.
author: Blake F.

description: I hate that this place only open until 5PM, I missed the chance to eat here almost everyday when I was in SF, but the last day I made it my mission to try this place out. Came in for lunch, there was a bit of a wait. The place is really clean, even the restroom. I mean it's a cleanest restroom I have been to in a Vietnamese restaurant to date. I was shock. Didn't know why I ordered a chicken pho, and it came out ok. The sticky rice was not that good either. However, all the four stars goes to Bun Cha Ha Noi. Highly recommend, it's as authentic as it can get. *thumbs-up*
author: Hoang D.

description: Definitely a huge improvement over the old place or the one that's currently in SoMa. Same great food, much cleaner atmosphere (but honestly, sometimes pho taste better in dirty, grungy places). Come earlier to avoid the wait, about 10 people were waiting for a table when we left the restaurant around noon.
author: Daniel K.

description: redeemed the $18 groupon offer . it includes either 2  soup or rice dishes &2 drinks for up to $18 .
author: Brian L.

description: The best chicken pho.  There are at least a dozen pho places near here, and Turtle Tower is the only one with a line.  That says everything!
author: Andrew L.

description: Happened to pass by the other day and stopped in for lunch. It was nearly full but found a seat.  Staff was friendly and it was pretty clean inside. Food came quickly and it was very tasty.  Had the vietnamese iced coffee as well which was nice and not too sweet.  Definitely would come back again if I am in the area.
author: Eric H.

description: I just get the pho ga here. The broth is like comfort food to me. Simple and light but full of flavor. I usually marinate the side of jalapeños in lemon juice, fish sauce and salt and pepper and add a piece of jalapeño to a spoonful of broth, noodles and chicken...mmmm will always be coming back when I'm craving pho!
author: Christine W.

description: My co-workers took me out for my birthday last week and treated me to Turtle Tower pho. At first I didn't think too much about it since they took me out to Turtle Tower a few years ago at their former location and I wasn't impressed. BUT!!! At their new location I must say the soup was delicious! I really enjoyed the fresh noodles, the soup was very tasty without the addition of any other sauces. It was so good that I had to go back today. Luckily I was a single eater so I didn't have to wait too long for a table. They seat you with other single eaters so it could be awkward, but no big deal for me. I needed to eat a good hot meal--fast. Since the food, at least to me, seems more fresh, the prices are higher than typical pho restaurants, but the portions are good and well worth it! Oh yes, and it's CASH ONLY.
author: Annie P.

description: While visting SF, my husband and sought out this place after a sushi chef told us about it the night before.  the Pho Ga is delicious!!!  also my husband says (who loves anything fried) that their egg rolls are the best he's ever had.  We're going to SF at the end of the month and we'll definitely come here for their pho ga and egg rolls!
author: JoAnn H.

description:
I would have given a four star review a year ago when they were still at the old location. Now they moved, and although the ambience improved a bit - not by much, it's noisy like hell inside, tables and chairs sprung out all over places and did not seem to follow any pattern or order. The lady owner looks happy - her smile is bigger, eventually they got to a larger place, but maybe too happy they've forgotten about what matters most: the food.

I ordered the beef pho today - tái gu. The young girl who was our server did not speak Vietnamese, so she couldn't understand the specifics. Moved on to a guy who could ... When the pho was brought out, its soup was too salty. I might understand how it happened, it was late noon and the evaporation might have been a bit too much, but don't you need to taste your own food if you are a chef? And the rare beef is nothing rare. It was overcooked and lumped together into hard to chew big pieces.

Moving on to another dish - the egg rolls - too brown, over deep fried. I want to stop writing now.

So in my opinion, the restaurant is still a cash cow for its owner (is it owned by Vietnamese or Chinese now?) but the food has been on the decline. I no longer feel the need to go to SF for my bowl of pho at Turtle Tower!
author: Thanh N.

description: Fantastic.Be sure to get a side of chicken or a side of beef to go with your Pho ga or Pho Bo.
author: Elaine N.

description: So I did not realize that this place serves their pho northern style which means no hoisin sauce and not fresh veggies and herbs. The broth is much lighter in flavor than the traditional broth which has a stronger star anis and richer flavor. I don't think the food is very good but I'm giving them 3 stars because the service was excellent. They could tell that I did not like the northern style pho so they invited me back to try the chicken soup which they say is really good. I think this one goes to team south. Northern style pho definitely has nothing on southern style pho.
author: Mai C.

description: new location friendlier service, no cockroaches in sight yet
author: Long C.

description: Fresh flat rice noodle with raw beef slices dipped in soup, comfort food at it's best.
author: Sydney L.

description: Underwhelming. Long wait, so-so pho. The broth was nothing special and perhaps even a little oily. Chicken pho (Pho Ga) had lots of chicken skin (up to you if you like that). If you're used to the chain pho shops, you'll be disappointed; the person with me had to ask for a fork three or four times (I use chopsticks) and they don't serve hoisin sauce.   Tips: Cash only and don't take a vegetarian here because there are no vegetarian options.
author: Amy L.

description: Beer selection is huge. Ask them for pairing suggestions! Not my type of pho though, very sweet and MSG-y
author: Emma T.

description: Came here with friends who say that this is their favourite pho place in SF. They serve it Northern Vietnamese style which means no bean sprouts and green stuff on top of the noodles. The broth is chicken and not beef like elsewhere. It's a clear, clean flavoured broth and they use slightly thicker pho noodles. Not bad. The rice paper rolls is enormous, one order is enough for 4 people. Don't think it is a starter for one unless you have an American appetite. It's recently been renovated and is quite clean and service is friendly. Be warned, it is in the Tenderloin and if you are not driving, it's a dodgy area to walk around. Best thing is the Vietnamese snack shop next door for afters.
author: May C.

description: Love this place. Never tired of coming back. Their noodles and the broth and the young chicken meats are tasty. There is not much grease or fats at all. That's why I always come here.
author: judy t.

description: Awesome food! Fast service! The chicken noodle soup gets me to come back time and time again!
author: Allen L.

description: If you love Vietnamese food, you're going to love this place! I spent some time in Hanoi and Turtle Tower is the real deal! Bun cha, pho bo, pho ga, spring rolls, etc! I have never had a bad meal here and kept coming back almost every day during my week in San Francisco. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the owner, Steven (Nghia) even invited me to share some tea with him and chat about my travels to Vietnam!
author: Chris G.

description: Maybe I have a high standard when it comes to pho since I've eaten it most of my life. This place is terrible. A friend of ours recommended this place to us. Said it was out-of-this-world good. My boyfriend and I were beyond disappointed with both the beef and chicken pho we ordered. Not only did it lack the infamous pho flavor, it did not come with our accustomed bean sprouts and greens side. Something we're not used to. Definitely will not be back. Thanks for the horrifying experience though, Turtle Tower.
author: Nhu Hao T.

description:
Ok, I just came here for the 2nd time, and tried out their sandwiches. They are Phenomenal, easily the best I've had in Little Saigon, and also cheaper than most.

The only disadvantage I can think of is that this place usually closes at 5, so I can't eat the sandwiches all night!
author: Ned D.

description: Amazing pho ga, amazing spring rolls, and super cheap too. They use organic chicken and it shows, broth is super clean, no oil in sight. I just wish they had mint for the pho... but amazing place. So glad its near where I live! Best hangover cure ever/comfort food
author: Alexandra V.

description: Very impressed with spacious new digs on Larkin few doors down from previous location . Lovely seating, bright and airy and the same wonderful pho (chicken)and Banh mi.great service
author: Patricia A.

description: New digs... still the best! Chicken noodle soup with the fresh noodles can't be beat.
author: David G.

description:
I only ever have the Pho Ga here. Never bothered for the other stuff cuz to be honest, no other place in the city makes Pho Ga like this place. There's another Pho Ga place I like in Chinatown but that's more Chinese. 

Anyhoo, the Pho Ga here is no frills, straight up Pho Ga. Nothing fancy schmancy. Just good ol' chicken pho. I love the thick rice noodles they use. (Frankly, the rice stick noodles should only be for beef pho). I never have to add anything (except maybe jalapenos cuz I like mine with a bit of a kick to it) and my picky toddler will slurp up a kid-sized bowl on her own. I also like that you can have the pho with giblets and order giblets on the side. Wait can be long if you come at during lunch and dinner time. I come right after the lunch rush (2:00pm) and there's hardly a wait. I also like that they provide kid friendly utensils and food scissors if you need it. Out of all the Turle Tower locations in the area, this one is the best. No 5 star rating because I didn't try the other dishes. But is there really a need to? This place is known for Pho Ga.
author: Z L.

description: Super good pho, clean and open kitchen, nice service:)
author: Yurika O.

description: Fantastic PHO!  I do wish there was a bit more of the fresh herbs/veggies to add to the Pho but the PHO itself is fantastic.
author: Sandra S.

description: I can only really comment on the Chicken Pho (pho ga), but it is awesome... it is seriously the best I've ever had. It is the perfect comfort food.
author: John T.

description: Love the new location! Food is still great, but the line to get in is a bit long... Had to wait for 30 min. Best to go before 11:30am or after 2pm. Still, you can't go wrong with this place if you want authentic Vietnamese food!
author: Scott H.

description: New location... Seemingly less noodles and service was not as good. The place is super clean looking though. I saw the waitress refill the hot sauce... Drops the cap... Didn't wash it... Refills the sauce.... Then puts it back on.... I was speechless. Plus they close much earlier than before which is surprising.
author: Eva Y.

description: I had a particular craving for pho in the midst of yesterday's raininess, and after wandering around for a bit in the TL ended up here. Nothing fancy, but clean, quick and friendly service, decent pho but not amazingly flavorful or anything. There were lots of pieces of fat in my chicken soup. Other places give you basil and bean sprouts, but this place only provided lemon and jalapeno which was a little underwhelming. The spring rolls were good, but I didn't realize until after eating them that aside from the shrimp there was also beef in them. Careful. Thai iced tea was good. I'd probably go again if I were in the area (which I make a habit never to be).
author: Natalie H.

description: Great for traditional style Phô but didn't knock completely knock it out of the park but, this restaurant did pop my Phô cherry and now im completely hooked! My wife had the rare beef Phô and it was by far better than my chicken Phô so I ended up stealing hers. Their spring rolls were soo delicious and the peanut sauce was phenomenal and better then any others I've ever had. Highly recommended however that you get there early because we had a party of 6 at 10:00 am and there was no wait but shortly after the line was out the door.
author: Maria M.

description: Great northern Vietnamese style PHO~!
author: Susan G.

description: Dropped by for lunch after the Asian Art Museum .  Good friendly service .free range chicken soup was very good and nice noodles .  Used lemons  instead of limes.  Prefer limes.  beef was inedible as it smelled gamey!  Iced coffee was great . Generally not as good as the reviews say.  Nothing special .  Better pho elsewhere.
author: Cynthia Y.

description: The place is newly renovated and is very bright and clean.  Don't forget to sign your name in the front.  The pho here is different from other places I've been to.  They are known for their chicken pho but I got #4, the rare and well-done beef noodle bowl.  The prices are a bit high than most places I've been (About $9 for a large bowl) but definitely worth it.  There are no bean sprouts or basil to accompany it and the noodles are a little thicker (like fettuccine).  The beef slices are also cut thicker but is extremely tasty and flavorful.  The broth was  delicious and not too salty at all.  I did not feel the urge to drink a lot of water afterwards.  Overall, Turtle Tower is a delicious place for a nice Sunday afternoon lunch.  Next time, I will try the chicken pho!
author: Cindy C.

description: B-O-M-B.com Must Try! Boyfriend and i drove deep into the TL just to have a fresh clean bowl of pho! I also like the fact is they serve it without all the extra condiments... The broth is to die for and that is why all the other crap is NOT needed! A definite must TRY!! Nom Nom xcD
author: Neveah S.

description: They remodeled and moved into a bigger spot in the tenderloin. I really like the broth and noodles at turtle tower because it doesn't taste as heavy as the pho at other places. However my husband prefers more of the southern Vietnamese pho style . I always get the chicken pho. It has never disappoint since they first opened in the tiny alley corner spot. Service is fine and quick. One star down because there is always a wait time because their busy even with the larger space and also because the pho is still good but it didn't taste as good as the earlier days. Still recommend it for pho though!
author: Judy C.

description: After all these years in the city, I FINALLY managed to make it out to Turtle Tower to try the famous Pho Ga people always raved about. It's different from the usual pho I have (thin noodles, hoison sauce, chili garlic oil, basil leaves, etc.) but it is tasty. The broth was very refreshing and overall, I liked it, but I wasn't crazy about it. Being a chicken dish, there wasn't a whole lot of chicken so that was a disappointment. But overall, it was good but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back. Know that service was good and inside atmosphere was nice.
author: Hwan L.

description: Large #9 Pho Ga is excellent. Not as big of portion as the other pho places but the taste is a lot better. Gets busy and worth the wait.
author: Collin L.

description:
I never had a pho like this. The soup broth was really good and noodle too
BEST IN TOWN!!!
author: Micheal D.

description: This is the blandest pho I've ever had in my life. The noodles were bland, the broth bland and the steak was just ground beef (which was also bland). There are plenty of great Vietnamese places in Little Saigon, you should avoid this place unless you really want  "Northern-style" food.
author: John L.

description: The worst pho I ever had in my life, I understand it is Northern Viet cuisine, where it is not common to eat pho with hoisin, grounded real chili paste, basil, and bean sprouts, but at least make the broth tasty. My raw beef pho came out looking like brain from a horror Hannibal Lector movie in a yellow bouillon flavored cup-a-noodle looking soup. I expected more from this place and the reviews, Zagat definitely got their ratings wrong. DO NOT EAT HERE horrible pho, horrible spring rolls and egg rolls with no real mint to wrap them with and no peanuts in the fish sauce! And do not get me started with the rice porridge maybe their rice dishes and sandwiches are better who knows. Definitely one of the most horrific tasting pho I ever had. I left feeling used and hungry.
author: Lina R.

description: I totally don't get the hype. I'm Viet and I love me some good pho, but I always grew up with beef pho with the herbs, lemon, hoisin. Apart from that, the chicken pho itself just wasn't very flavorful. I just don't get the hype.
author: Caroline D.

description: I've been to many Vietnamese pho places, so I don't know what the rave is about this place.  My brother and I came here for lunch since we heard good things about this place.  We'd tried a couple other places around the area.  This one was not what I'd expected.   Their pho is not even real Vietnamese Pho.  For one, the soup base is just regular chicken broth.  You don't use chicken broth in the real Vietnamese Pho.  Secondly, the noodles were much broader than the trational.  This place is American style versus the true Vietnamese noodles.  Unless they change their menu, I don't think I'll come back.
author: Angela T.

description: cashier lady is really rude and unprofessional and she yell to us. the food is fine but i wont to that restaurant again.
author: Jason J.

description: Finally went to turtle tower and was pleasantly surprised on how great everything tasted. The pho (stir fry beef with veggies) was great with flavorful broth.  The small was large enough.  The banh mee was ok.  I would go for the pho alone.
author: around town e.

description: Delicious Pho! I have tried them all and believe this spot to be one of the best in the city.
author: Caroline S.

description: This is the Vietnamese restaurant I go to when I'm in San Francisco. It has the most authentic Northern style pho. I also take out of town visitors here. It's definitely the better pho place in San Francisco!
author: Bao N.

description: hahaha. Eddy N. i don't know why you need to be so UPSET about turtle tower simply just asking if you would be able to share a table. i witnessed what happened that day & all the owner did was ask. she didn't force it upon you & when you said no, she didn't mean mug or put you to shame of any sort. turtle tower isn't fancy dining. people come to eat, not look for the perfect seat and as we all know, it gets very busy. they don't ask people to share table to piss them off, they ask because they want to make sure everyone gets to eat as soon as they can while everyone's stomach is empty. was a simple question really going to throw you off all the way to make you think they are greedy for money? LOL!! they share tables FOR customers, not for money. oh & did they force in a customer to sit next to you guys in the end? ? did you work for turtle tower or something? how could u be so positive that they would steal tips if you are merely just a customer. & let me ask you. you've been eating at turtle tower for "YEARS".., SO.. you enjoy the food im guessing? all it took was one simple question for you to bash on a family that's been serving the community for over 13 years with love and soul and think it was their "nerve" to do so. you should be ashamed of yourself. But honestly haters will hate. the servers probably make more money than you than you even know. lol you're so funny.
author: Anne C.

description: The chicken meat that they put in the soup is old.  They should incorporate new meat in the soup.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: I yelped this place pre SF travel with excitement and a big appetite for delicious Vietnamese cuisine. I wish I could give this place no stars at all. But I feel like I had to share my thoughts on my dining experience. I ordered spring rolls that came out much smaller than I've ever seen with less veggie fillings compared to other orders I've had back in Seattle. For $5.25 that was a rip off. I ordered the brisket and flank pho that came with small bite size pieces of crumbled and fatty meat. Then my bean sprouts, limes, basil and onions were non existent. Apparently they don't give those out here. Strange. I went to reach for the hoisin sauce and it was invisible. We asked the server and they said they don't have that here. For the over priced, flavorless, shady portions and missing condiments, I definitely don't understand where the 4 stars came from. We'll never dine here again or refer it. And since it was cash only...that's another check mark on the list of bad restaurant etiquette in my book!
author: Alice H.

description: damn good chicken noodle soup, probably the one of the best! only thing is the weird vibe and snobby hipster customers in there who seem to be competing with you from the moment u walk in the door. lots of up and down looks and smirks. everytime i go there the same thing, but has nothing to do with the food or the service, js the customers....its like a room full of haters, hahaha. maybe my pants arent tight enough, sorry forgot my pink rimmed sunglasses. but yea the food is very good
author: Sammy D.

description: I came here for lunch and enjoyed the pho. The herbs were chopped up very finely and put into the soup for you, which was a nice way to serve it, giving each bite tons of herbaceous flavor (instead of relying on the sweet sauce and sriracha combo--those bottles are missing from the table, which was good for a change). The vietnamese coffee was also done well. It was nice to be able to watch the World Cup on their TVs while eating alone. I feel compelled to write a review because the staff here went way above and beyond to show me kindness when I was in a little bit of a sticky situation. Thank you Turtle Tower for being so nice to me! It is very satisfying to support a business when it's being run by good people. Busy but not crazy on a weekday. CASH only.
author: Liz J.

description: my sister all time favorite chicken noodle place. i like it, broth tasted good, not too salty! just perfect!
author: Winnie C.

description:
I came here for the first time with one of my friend since he's never had vietnamese food before. We came here because we were at the tenderloin and one of my good friend also works here but he was off today. My friend who works here spoke very highly about it on Facebook so I thought I'd try it. My other friend who came with me to eat here were dissappointed. I can't really say what Vietnamese food is supposed to be like because I'm not Vietnamese. But I've had Vietnamese food from different locations and I've had better than this place. My friend ordered Pho and I ordered Vermicelli noodle with grilled pork chops. Both dishes were a little bland. I had to pour some fish sauce and sriracha just to add taste. The dish were very greasy as well. I can tell my friend and I weren't the only customer with overly greasy food because I saw every tray that went by, had films of grease all over it. 

The service, boy, they were quick to get our orders like they were rushing because we just sat down no more than 10 seconds ago and they were already asking as what we wanted. We told them 1 more minute, and they came back not even a minute. But the time it took to get the drinks, the food, and even the check was soooooo... slow.

I give it 1 star for my friend who works here and 1 star for one of their staff who's really cute. =D
author: John A.

description: I like Turtle Tower - but I think like is the operative word here.  It's not 3 stars because 3 stars means it's just okay and I think it's good, but I don't particularly love it either.  I think it has a good solid broth but I'm not a huge fan of the noodles or the chicken.  I mean it tastes good but  I think personally the noodles (they have regular and egg) and the chicken meat (it's just regular chicken meat) don't really do it for me.  I've had the imperial rolls quite a few times and I think they're good as well - really solid - but as someone who prefers bun bo hue I think really the broth is what I like here and not so much pho in general.  Another good place with really good broth is My Father's Kitchen which I think I like more - both their beef broth and chicken broth are delicious.  Turtle Tower is a really popular spot with my coworkers and friends though - also their coffee is great - but very strong!
author: Sophia D.

description: I like the new location, bright, feels cleaner and have a bit more space.  The chicken noodles is very flavorful but the portion is a bit small.
author: Susan Q.

description: My mother and I took our relatives who were visiting San Francisco to try this place. This review is for the #4 combination for beef. The broth was very on point, along with the thick pho noodles. I like it, but I don't love it. However, their customer service is great. I think this is because they hire young adult employees. I will come back if I am in the area. Otherwise, I wouldn't drive out of my way to eat here.
author: Karen T.

description: Used to love this place, not sure what happened to the broth (very watery and little chicken taste for chicken pho)
author: A C.

description: I have loved this place for years- not only are the owners stellar people who remember me and ask about my life, but the pho is just the best that there is, hands down. I am a pho aficionado- It's my fave food & I eat it probably 4 times a week- Nowhere has the northern vietnamese style like turtle tower- nowhere. I always judge a pho place on it's imperial rolls, too- so many places use a fried wrapper that is much like what you get when ordering chinese food- meh- but not turtle tower- it's imperial rolls, though small and expensive compared to other places, are a treat- they are lightly crispy and melt in your mouth at the same time.... delicious. I cannot say anything bad about any of their locations, although the TL one is always going to hold a special place in my heart! TT Pho-ever! Also, I have two babies that were basically fed turtle tower in utero for 9 months.... They came out loving vietnamese food just as much as I do! Here's to the next generation of turtle tower lovers!
author: C V.

description: Their chicken pho is to die for! Their Beef pho is awesome too! If you come on a weekend for lunch, be prepared for a line. The best thing is that you can call in and have it to go, it's nomrally ready in 15 minutes.
author: Kate J.

description: I give it four stars mostly because they use organic meat.  Device was friendly but they clearly rush you.  We had never been to the  place before and after having our menus for less than a minute an eager waitress asked if we knew what we wanted.  When we said we didn't know, she gave us this exasperated look and just stood there, as if to say, "hurry up and decide, you're lucky you have a table."  We both ordered the Pho, one chicken one beef.  Broth was not as flavorful as I expected from other reviews. Overall it was very good, not great.
author: Ashley K.

description: new location 10x cleaner, servers speak english, like
author: Edward S.

description: Best place to go for lunch on a weekend. I would highly recommend ordering either the chicken noodles or the beef stewed noodles. Awesome!
author: Harry B.

description: still coming here every weekend for 5+ years now. the new location is great and nice and clean and pretty inside. and much more spacious. and you can't go wrong with anything you order here!
author: Kristine T.
